intro: Nidorella resedifolia subsp. resedifolia, commonly known as the slender leaf nidorella, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. It has a fibrous root system and produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
